column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Lingala alphabet, written in the Latin script.

name
  1. Kimwenza (a town in the Democratic Republic of the Congo)

name
  1. Kinshasa (the capital city of the Democratic Republic of the Congo)

name
  1. Matadi (a city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo)

name
  1. Mbandaka (a city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo)

pron
  1. The personal pronoun, 3rd person plural form; they.

pron
  1. The personal pronoun, 2nd person plural form; you (i.e. you all).

pron
  1. The personal pronoun, 1st person plural form; we.

noun
  1. semolina or flour, especially of cassava
  2. porridge, made from fufú and water by boiling and stirring until solid

verb
  1. to reign, to dominate
  2. to take charge of, to direct

verb
  1. to paint, to anoint
  2. to lightly rub
  3. to continue, to progress

noun
  1. sanza; mbira; likembe
  2. sound produced in the throat when swallowing

noun
  1. palm (tree); (in particular) the oil palm, Elaeis guineensis

noun
  1. Eru or African jointfir: a species of plant (Gnetum africanum) common to tropical Africa, used as a vegetable.

conj
  1. for, because
  2. so as to, in order to

noun
  1. paste, more particularly palm butter or peanut butter

prep
  1. with, and
  2. in, at
  3. of (form of ya before personal pronouns)

verb
  1. to proclaim, to declare, to announce
  2. to witness

verb
  1. to support, to contribute
  2. to meet, to assemble

verb
  1. to do
  2. to work; to act
  3. to make; to create

verb
  1. to declare, to announce
  2. to witness, to give witness, to testify

verb
  1. to thin, to become thinner, to slim

verb
  1. to make thin
  2. to annoy, to disturb
  3. to vex, to irritate

verb
  1. to send
  2. to assign, to command, to order

pron
  1. The third person singular pronoun for classes 7 and 9; it.
  2. (colloquial) The third person inanimate pronoun; it, they.

pron
  1. The third person singular pronoun; he, she.

verb
  1. to obtain, to take
  2. to receive
  3. to pass a test
  4. to succeed, to win

pron
  1. (demonstrative) this, that, these, those
  2. (relative) that, which, who

adj
  1. (demonstrative) this, that, these, those
